document.title: Handwriting Recognition: Writer Identification and Verification in Handwritten Documents Using Hybrid Deep Learning Techniques
document.description: Multi-model AI system that transcribes IAM handwriting samples while fingerprinting each writer via CRNN, Siamese, and boosted hybrid pipelines.

body.raw:
## Overview This project analyzes images from the IAM Handwriting Dataset for two objectives at once: transcribing the written words/sentences and identifying who wrote them. CNN, CRNN, SVM, Siamese Networks, and XGBoost configurations all run through the same experimental pipeline, creating a reproducible blueprint for biometric verification, forensic analysis, and intelligent document workflows. ## Project Motivation Conventional handwriting systems only learn _what_ was written. Here the pipeline also models _who_ wrote it by capturing cues like stroke pressure, spacing, slant, and rhythm. Recognition and verification models share the same data path so even with few samples, the system can still attribute authorship. ## Dataset & Preprocessing - Selected the 49 IAM writers with the most samples, yielding 4,207 single-channel 113Ã—113 images. - Applied margin cropping, grayscale normalization, and augmentation (rotation, inversion, noise) to enrich data. - One-hot encoded writer labels and used stratified train/validation/test splits to keep classes balanced.
The verification problem changes difficulty depending on how distinctive the handwriting is. I therefore curated two qualitative buckets that were used for human-in-the-loop checks:
## Model Architectures ### CNN Extracts spatial stroke features and delivers ~77% writer accuracy as the baseline classifier. ### CRNN Stacks CNN and BiLSTM layers so the network learns shape, rhythm, and sequence; CTC loss supports fast transcription plus ~88% writer accuracy. ### CNN + SVM Feeds CNN embeddings into an SVM decision boundary, reaching ~87% accuracy and blending deep features with classical ML for smaller datasets. ### CRNN + SVM Supplies temporal CRNN features to an SVM classifier for 89.9% accuracy and improved robustness to writer-to-writer variation. ### CRNN + XGBoost Runs gradient-boosted trees on CRNN feature vectors, capturing complex interactions and delivering the best accuracy at 90.32%. ### Siamese Network Uses weight-sharing CNN twins with contrastive loss to decide whether two samples came from the same writer; ~85% verification accuracy adds a dedicated security layer. ## Multi-Task Learning Shared convolutional and recurrent layers learn both tasks simultaneously: 1. CTC-based handwriting recognition. 2. Style-driven writer classification. This shared feature bank yields richer representations, better training efficiency, and workflows that mirror real forensic pipelines. ### Optimization & Training Stability The CRNN variants were run through staged learning-rate windows until convergence. Loss curves stayed smooth thanks to gradient clipping and CTC stabilization:
## Performance Summary | Model | Accuracy | Notes | | ---------------------- | -------- | ------------------------------------------------- | | CNN | 77.70% | Strong spatial learner, limited temporal modeling | | CRNN | 88.69% | Excellent sequence modeling | | CNN + SVM | 87.46% | Deep features plus classical boundary | | CRNN + SVM | 89.96% | Temporal features with SVM synergy | | **CRNN + XGBoost** | **90.32%** | **Best overall performance** | | Siamese (verification) | 85.35% | Binary scoring for writer verification | Each experiment ships with confusion matrices, per-writer metrics, and probability distribution charts.
## Strengths - Comprehensive comparison of multiple architectures in a single pipeline. - Fair evaluation via a balanced IAM subset. - Strong hybrid performance from CRNN + XGBoost and CRNN + SVM. - Siamese verification layer primes the system for biometric deployments. - Visualizations and reporting tailored for forensic stakeholders (examples above). ## Key Contributions - Trained and compared six models (CNN, CRNN, hybrids, Siamese) under one infrastructure with uniform logging. - Introduced a writer-ID approach that feeds CRNN features into XGBoost. - Demonstrated dual-task learning where transcription and author ID share the same network. - Published the balanced IAM subset pipeline for reproducibility. ## Applications - Forensic document reviews and signature/check verification. - Biometric identity authentication systems. - Archive automation and historical handwriting analytics. - Intelligent handwriting analysis for banking or contract control. ## Conclusion The CRNN + XGBoost combo proves how deep sequential learning and ensemble decisions reinforce each other, while the Siamese verifier supplies the identity-check layer production systems expect. Overall the pipeline offers both scientific rigor and field readiness for handwriting-based biometrics. ## Summary I built an end-to-end AI pipeline that transcribes IAM handwriting with CTC while learning writer identity, elevates CRNN + XGBoost to peak accuracy, and layers on Siamese verification for additional security.

document.title: Lithium-Ion Battery Aging Analysis
document.description: 23-month Stanford Energy Control Lab study modeling LIB capacity fade, impedance growth, anomalies, and SOH predictions with Random Forest + linear baselines.

body.raw:
## Overview This study relies on 23 months of Stanford Energy Control Lab data to analyze lithium-ion battery capacity fade, impedance growth, and energy degradation. Advanced statistics, exploratory data analysis, anomaly detection, and machine learning combine to produce actionable State of Health (SOH) forecasts for BMS deployments, EV maintenance, and grid-scale storage diagnostics. ## Motivation - Capacity fade, impedance growth, and thermal stress increase risk for EVs and stationary storage alike. - Accurate SOH estimation informs warranty exposure, Remaining Useful Life planning, and chemistry R&D. - The pipeline trains on real driving/charging patterns, yielding high-fidelity predictions grounded in field data. ## Dataset Description Two complementary sources feed the models: 1. **Cycling dataset:** Captures charge/discharge behavior with voltage, current, temperature, capacity, step index, and test time across CC/CV charging and UDDS discharge profiles. 2. **Diagnostic dataset:** Periodic capacity tests, EIS, and HPPC sessions expose long-term degradation trends that daily cycling alone might miss. ## Exploratory Data Analysis - **Voltage & Current:** Charging stabilizes around 4.20 V while current stays within controlled limits. - **Capacity Decline:** Early formation loss appears as a sharp drop, followed by gradual stabilization. - **Temperature:** Readings cluster near 23 Ã‚ deg C with spikes during high-load events. - **Correlation:** Strong relationships such as Discharge Energy Ã¢â€ â€ Test Time and Voltage Ã¢â€ â€ Step Index guide feature engineering. - **Anomaly Detection:** Isolation Forest flags abnormal voltage dips, thermal spikes, and irregular discharge episodes, improving downstream model reliability.
## Machine Learning Pipeline Two prediction tasks drive the modeling: 1. **State of Health (SOH) Prediction** 2. **Discharge Energy (Wh) Prediction** Features come from both cycling and diagnostic streams, focusing on signals with clear physical meaning. ### SOH Prediction (Random Forest) - **Inputs:** Test time, voltage, current, and charge energy. - **Performance:** RÃ‚^2Ã¢â‚¬Â¯=Ã¢â‚¬Â¯0.9875, MAEÃ¢â‚¬Â¯=Ã¢â‚¬Â¯0.14, RMSEÃ¢â‚¬Â¯=Ã¢â‚¬Â¯0.24. - Ten-fold cross-validation confirms generalization, making the model ready for real-time BMS integration.
### Energy Prediction (Linear Regression) Discharge energy is modeled as a linear combination of test time and step index: ``` E_discharge = ÃŽ^20 + ÃŽ^21 * TestTime + ÃŽ^22 * StepIndex ``` - **RÃ‚^2:** 0.7321 - **RMSE:** 3.04 - **MAE:** 2.37 This lightweight estimator gives fast energy forecasts for embedded systems. ### Clustering Analysis K-Means segments cycles into three degradation profiles: - **Cluster 1 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Healthy:** Highest capacity and lowest temperature variance. - **Cluster 2 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Moderate Aging:** Predictable voltage behavior with mid-level degradation. - **Cluster 3 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Severe Aging:** Frequent voltage drops, thermal instability, and minimal capacity. These clusters support targeted maintenance and replacement strategies. ## Key Findings - The Random Forest SOH model surpasses published benchmarks with near-perfect accuracy. - Test time, voltage, current, and step index emerge as dominant predictors. - K-Means reveals distinct degradation behavior groups for proactive decision-making. - Isolation Forest outlier removal boosts data quality and model trustworthiness. - Even small temperature shifts correlate strongly with SOH decline, underscoring thermal management needs. ## Practical Applications - **BMS:** Real-time SOH and Remaining Useful Life estimates with automated degradation alerts. - **EV Fleets:** Predictive maintenance, range-accuracy improvements, and warranty optimization. - **R&D & Manufacturing:** Early-cycle loss diagnostics, new chemistry evaluation, and improved formation processes. ## Conclusion Combining statistical analysis, EDA, Random Forests, linear regression, clustering, and anomaly detection provides a full picture of lithium-ion battery aging. With RÃ‚^2Ã¢â‚¬Â¯=Ã¢â‚¬Â¯0.9875 on SOH predictions, the pipeline demonstrates how data-driven diagnostics can transform EV and industrial energy storage operations while laying a solid foundation for future predictive battery analytics. ## Summary I built a comprehensive battery-aging analysis that ingests 23 months of cycling plus diagnostic data, models capacity fade and energy degradation with high-accuracy Random Forest and regression baselines, and pinpoints risky cycles via K-Means and Isolation Forest.

document.title: Secure Web-Based Messaging System
document.description: AES-256 encrypted enterprise chat for Kultur Technologies with Go backend, responsive web UI, and PostgreSQL persistence tailored to internal comms.

body.raw:
## Overview This full-stack platform, built for Kultur Technologies, keeps browser-based messaging fully in-house to satisfy confidentiality, integrity, and real-time workflow requirements. A Go API layer applies AES-256 encryption, PostgreSQL stores all messages plus key metadata, and an HTML/CSS/JS interface delivers a responsive chat experience across desktop and mobile.
## Motivation - Cyber threats and data-leak risks targeting enterprise chat channels continue rising. - Commercial SaaS tools are costly, closed-source, and often inflexible. - The goal was to build a company-controlled messaging stack with end-to-end encryption and a customizable web UX. ## Project Objectives - Design secure messaging with AES-256. - Support real-time text and multimedia sharing. - Implement strong authentication and access control. - Model a structured PostgreSQL schema with isolated key storage. - Provide a responsive front end that optimizes usability. ## System Architecture ### Frontend (HTML5/CSS3/JS) - Login/registration flows, chat panel, media upload/preview. - Responsive layouts for mobile and desktop with instant message rendering. ### Backend (Go) - Manages sessions and token validation. - Routes messages, queues delivery, and leverages Go's concurrency. - Uses `crypto/aes` + `crypto/cipher` for AES-256 CBC encryption. - Handles multimedia encoding, API endpoints, and error management. ### Database (PostgreSQL) - Stores user profiles with hashed credentials. - Persists encrypted messages, timestamps, sender/receiver IDs. - Keeps 256-bit keys plus IV metadata inside a dedicated MessageKeys table. - ER model centers on Users, Messages, and MessageKeys to maintain referential integrity.
## Cryptographic Workflow 1. Generate a secure 256-bit key and random IV. 2. Encrypt message payload with AES-256 CBC and Base64 encode it. 3. Write ciphertext to PostgreSQL while storing keys in a separate table. 4. Decrypt only for authorized users; historical ciphers like Playfair or Vigenere were evaluated but rejected for insufficient strength.
## Core Functionality - **Authentication:** Validates hashed credentials, maintains sessions, and enforces input checks. - **Real-Time Messaging:** Enables direct text/multimedia exchange between authenticated users. - **Multimedia Sharing:** Encrypts and stores images server-side, decoding them for recipients. - **Key Management:** Separates message keys to add another defense layer against unauthorized access. - **Database Integrity:** Links every message to both users and key records for full traceability. ## Implementation Notes - Go backend exposes endpoints for message send/receive, authentication, and file uploads. - Frontend pages (`Auth.html`, `Chat.html`) handle async updates to keep the chat live. - Activity flow: user logs in Ã¢â€ â€™ backend issues JWT/session Ã¢â€ â€™ messages are encrypted and stored Ã¢â€ â€™ authorized clients decrypt on demand. ## Testing & Evaluation - **Authentication:** Verified valid/invalid login cases and brute-force protections. - **Messaging Stability:** Maintained low latency under concurrent message exchanges. - **AES Validation:** Confirmed proper error handling for malformed keys/IVs and correctness of encryption/decryption. - **Multimedia:** Ensured Base64-encoded images remain intact end to end. - **Cipher Benchmark:** Demonstrated AES-256 superiority over classical methods for both security and media compatibility. ## Security Strengths - AES-256 plus isolated key storage keeps database records unreadable. - Password hashing, form validation, and the modular Go backend minimize attack surface. - PostgreSQL constraints guarantee consistency and auditability. ## Applications - Internal corporate chat and secure document/image transfer. - Industries requiring strict confidentiality (finance, legal, consulting). - Remote teams needing custom, organization-owned collaboration tools. ## Conclusion By combining AES-256 encryption, Go services, PostgreSQL data modeling, and a modern web UI, the system delivers a messaging environment centered on confidentiality, integrity, and operational efficiency. It also lays groundwork for future upgrades such as group chats, automatic key rotation, message expiration, and broader end-to-end encryption features. ## Summary I engineered an AES-256 encrypted, Go-backed, PostgreSQL-persisted browser messaging platform for Kultur Technologies that unifies real-time chat, multimedia sharing, authentication, and key management in one secure architecture.

document.title: Visa Application Management System (VAMS)
document.description: Enterprise-grade relational data model that orchestrates every stage of global visa applications from intake to issuance.

body.raw:
## Overview The Visa Application Management System (VAMS) is a full database design that mirrors how consulates, visa centers, and immigration agencies collaborate in real life. Every actorâ€”applicants, application centers, consulates, finance teamsâ€”is modeled with normalized tables, enforced foreign keys, and workflow rules so the entire visa lifecycle can be queried, audited, and reported without ambiguity. ## System Objectives - Centralize all applicant, passport, document, and payment data in one relational source of truth. - Track submission, review, decision, and issuance events with referential integrity. - Model how applications flow between centers and consulates to avoid redundancy or anomalies. - Provide accurate joins for analytics, compliance checks, and operational dashboards. ## Key Entities & Responsibilities ### Applicant Captures identity, demographics, and contact info. Applicants can own several passports, open multiple applications, and submit fee payments. Nationality, birth data, and communication fields are mandatory to satisfy consular requirements. ### Passport Stores passport numbers (PK), issue/expiry dates, issuing authority, and type. Each record links back to exactly one applicant but any applicant can hold zero or many passports over time. ### Application Represents each visa request with IDs, purpose of travel, destination country, submission timestamp, and status transitions (Pending, Under Review, Approved, Rejected). Every application is tied to required documents, a submission center, and a reviewing consulate. ### Application Documents Metadata describing the documentation needed per visa class (name, description, validity window). Documents can be reused across applications while enforcing dependencies through junction tables. ### Payment Logs transactions with payment IDs, amount, method, currency, and fee names. Each payment references the applicant who paid and the application center that received the funds (`Made_To`). ### Application Center Models visa submission offices with contact info, address, hours, and appointment capacity. Centers mediate between applicants and consulates for both paperwork and payments. ### Consulate Represents the sovereign authority (PK = Consulate Name) that reviews cases and issues final decisions. Stores jurisdiction, contact channels, and locations. One consulate can handle many application types or countries. ### Visa Result Captures the official outcome for each processed application, including approval/rejection, reasoning, and a result ID. Links both the reviewing consulate and the visa artifact if the decision is positive. ### Visa Materializes the issued visa with IDs, visa type (tourist/business/student/etc.), validity range, and the consulate that granted it. Visas only exist if an associated visa result is approved, reinforcing dependency constraints. ## Relationship Modeling - **Applicant â†’ Passport:** One-to-many ownership; every passport belongs to a single applicant. - **Applicant â†’ Application:** Applicants can file multiple requests. - **Application â†” Documents:** Many-to-many through requirement tables, allowing document reuse. - **Application Center:** Receives applications and payments, acting as intake and treasury. - **Consulate â†’ Application:** Each application is reviewed by a consulate authority. - **Consulate â†’ Visa Result:** Decisions originate from consulates and reference downstream visa records. - **Visa Result â†’ Visa:** Visas are created only after an approved decision, preserving lifecycle order. The enhanced ER diagram captures cardinalities and participation constraints so downstream teams understand exactly how data moves between parties.
## Relational Schema & Normalization All tables are normalized to Third Normal Form, eliminating partial and transitive dependencies. Primary keys are explicitly defined, foreign keys enforce referential integrity, and every attribute is atomic. This guarantees consistent updates, efficient joins, and anomaly-free reporting even under heavy operational load. ## System Strengths - Highly normalized relational core purpose-built for visa workflows. - Traceable processing pipeline from application intake through decision and issuance. - Clear separation of responsibilities between applicants, centers, consulates, and financial records. - Strong FK constraints that mirror real-world accountability in immigration systems. - Comprehensive EER documentation that accelerates onboarding for analysts or developers. ## Potential Enhancements - Append audit logging to record who changed what and when. - Expand status tracking to cover each micro-stage (submission â†’ review â†’ decision â†’ issuance). - Allow multiple visa types under a single application to support families or multi-purpose travel. - Integrate online appointment booking and secure applicant authentication. - Store binary document uploads (BLOB/CLOB) alongside metadata for end-to-end traceability. ## Conclusion VAMS demonstrates enterprise-grade data modeling that captures the nuance of international visa processing. The project showcases advanced ER reasoning, disciplined normalization, and a workflow-aware schema that governments, consulates, or large visa centers could adopt with minimal changes. ## Summary VAMS is an enterprise-grade database design that keeps every stage from application intake to visa issuance consistent through normalization and strict referential integrity, so I can trace applicants, centers, consulates, payments, and decisions with confidence.

document.title: GÃ¼venli Web TabanlÄ± MesajlaÅŸma Sistemi
document.description: Kultur Technologies iÃ§in Go backend, duyarlÄ± web arayÃ¼zÃ¼ ve PostgreSQL ile AES-256 ÅŸifreli kurumsal mesajlaÅŸma.

body.raw:
## Genel BakÄ±ÅŸ Kultur Technologies iÃ§in geliÅŸtirilen bu full-stack platform, tarayÄ±cÄ± tabanlÄ± mesajlaÅŸmayÄ± tamamen kurum iÃ§inde tutarak gizlilik, bÃ¼tÃ¼nlÃ¼k ve gerÃ§ek zamanlÄ± iÅŸ akÄ±ÅŸÄ± gereksinimlerini karÅŸÄ±lÄ±yor. Go API katmanÄ± AES-256 ÅŸifreleme uygular, PostgreSQL tÃ¼m mesajlarÄ± ve anahtar metadatasÄ±nÄ± saklar, HTML/CSS/JS arayÃ¼zÃ¼ masaÃ¼stÃ¼ ve mobilde uyumlu, akÄ±cÄ± bir sohbet deneyimi sunar.
## Motivasyon - Kurumsal sohbet kanallarÄ±nÄ± hedef alan siber tehditler ve veri sÄ±zÄ±ntÄ±sÄ± riskleri artÄ±yor. - Ticari SaaS araÃ§larÄ± pahalÄ±, kapalÄ± ve Ã§oÄŸu zaman esnek deÄŸil. - AmaÃ§, uÃ§tan uca ÅŸifreleme ve Ã¶zelleÅŸtirilebilir bir web deneyimiyle kurum kontrolÃ¼nde bir mesajlaÅŸma yÄ±ÄŸÄ±nÄ± kurmaktÄ±. ## Proje Hedefleri - AES-256 ile gÃ¼venli mesajlaÅŸma tasarlamak - GerÃ§ek zamanlÄ± metin ve multimedya paylaÅŸÄ±mÄ±nÄ± desteklemek - GÃ¼Ã§lÃ¼ kimlik doÄŸrulama ve eriÅŸim kontrolÃ¼ uygulamak - AyrÄ±lmÄ±ÅŸ anahtar saklama ile yapÄ±landÄ±rÄ±lmÄ±ÅŸ PostgreSQL ÅŸemasÄ± modellemek - KullanÄ±labilirliÄŸi optimize eden duyarlÄ± bir Ã¶n yÃ¼z saÄŸlamak ## Sistem Mimarisi ### Frontend (HTML5/CSS3/JS) - GiriÅŸ / kayÄ±t akÄ±ÅŸlarÄ±, sohbet paneli, medya yÃ¼kleme / Ã¶nizleme - Mobil ve masaÃ¼stÃ¼nde duyarlÄ± yerleÅŸimler, anlÄ±k mesaj render'Ä± ### Backend (Go) - OturumlarÄ± ve token doÄŸrulamayÄ± yÃ¶netir - MesajlarÄ± yÃ¶nlendirir, kuyruÄŸa alÄ±r ve Go eÅŸzamanlÄ±lÄ±ÄŸÄ±ndan yararlanÄ±r - `crypto/aes` + `crypto/cipher` ile AES-256 CBC ÅŸifreleme uygular - Multimedya kodlama, API uÃ§larÄ± ve hata yÃ¶netimini ele alÄ±r ### VeritabanÄ± (PostgreSQL) - Karma kimlik bilgileriyle kullanÄ±cÄ± profillerini saklar - Åžifreli mesajlarÄ±, zaman damgalarÄ±nÄ±, gÃ¶nderici/alÄ±cÄ± kimliklerini kaydeder - 256 bit anahtarlarÄ± ve IV metadatasÄ±nÄ± ayrÄ±lmÄ±ÅŸ MessageKeys tablosunda tutar - ER modeli, referans bÃ¼tÃ¼nlÃ¼ÄŸÃ¼ iÃ§in Users, Messages ve MessageKeys Ã¼zerine kuruludur
## Kriptografik AkÄ±ÅŸ 1. GÃ¼venli 256 bit anahtar ve rastgele IV Ã¼ret. 2. Mesaj yÃ¼kÃ¼nÃ¼ AES-256 CBC ile ÅŸifrele, Base64 kodla. 3. Åžifreli metni PostgreSQL'e yaz, anahtarlarÄ± ayrÄ± tabloda sakla. 4. YalnÄ±zca yetkili kullanÄ±cÄ±lar iÃ§in Ã§Ã¶z; Playfair veya Vigenere gibi tarihsel ÅŸifreler yetersiz gÃ¼Ã§ nedeniyle reddedildi.
## Ã‡ekirdek Ã–zellikler - **Kimlik DoÄŸrulama:** Karma kimlik bilgilerini doÄŸrular, oturumlarÄ± sÃ¼rdÃ¼rÃ¼r, giriÅŸ kontrollerini uygular. - **GerÃ§ek ZamanlÄ± MesajlaÅŸma:** Yetkili kullanÄ±cÄ±lar arasÄ±nda doÄŸrudan metin/multimedya alÄ±ÅŸveriÅŸi. - **Multimedya PaylaÅŸÄ±mÄ±:** GÃ¶rselleri sunucu tarafÄ±nda ÅŸifreler ve alÄ±cÄ±lar iÃ§in Ã§Ã¶zer. - **Anahtar YÃ¶netimi:** Mesaj anahtarlarÄ±nÄ± ayÄ±rarak yetkisiz eriÅŸime karÅŸÄ± ek savunma katmanÄ± oluÅŸturur. - **VeritabanÄ± BÃ¼tÃ¼nlÃ¼ÄŸÃ¼:** Her mesajÄ± hem kullanÄ±cÄ± hem de anahtar kayÄ±tlarÄ±na baÄŸlayarak izlenebilirliÄŸi saÄŸlar. ## Uygulama NotlarÄ± - Go backend; mesaj gÃ¶nderme/alma, kimlik doÄŸrulama ve dosya yÃ¼kleme uÃ§larÄ± sunar. - Ã–n yÃ¼z sayfalarÄ± (`Auth.html`, `Chat.html`) sohbeti canlÄ± tutmak iÃ§in asenkron gÃ¼ncellemeleri yÃ¶netir. - AkÄ±ÅŸ: kullanÄ±cÄ± giriÅŸ yapar â†’ backend JWT/oturum Ã¼retir â†’ mesajlar ÅŸifrelenir ve saklanÄ±r â†’ yetkili istemciler talep Ã¼zerinde Ã§Ã¶zer. ## Test ve DoÄŸrulama - **Kimlik DoÄŸrulama:** GeÃ§erli/geÃ§ersiz giriÅŸ durumlarÄ± ve kaba kuvvet korumalarÄ± doÄŸrulandÄ±. - **MesajlaÅŸma KararlÄ±lÄ±ÄŸÄ±:** EÅŸzamanlÄ± mesaj alÄ±ÅŸveriÅŸlerinde dÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼k gecikme korundu. - **AES DoÄŸrulamasÄ±:** HatalÄ± anahtar/IV durumlarÄ±nda hata yÃ¶netimi ve ÅŸifreleme/ÅŸifre Ã§Ã¶zme doÄŸruluÄŸu test edildi.

document.title: El YazÄ±sÄ± TanÄ±ma: Hibrit Derin Ã–ÄŸrenme ile Yazar TanÄ±mlama ve DoÄŸrulama
document.description: CRNN, Siamese ve boost edilmiÅŸ hibrit hatlarla IAM el yazÄ±sÄ± Ã¶rneklerini hem Ã§Ã¶zen hem yazarÄ± parmak izi gibi tanÄ±mlayan Ã§ok modelli AI sistemi.

body.raw:
## Genel BakÄ±ÅŸ Bu proje, IAM Handwriting Dataset gÃ¶rÃ¼ntÃ¼lerini aynÄ± anda iki hedef iÃ§in iÅŸler: yazÄ±lan kelime/cÃ¼mleleri Ã§Ã¶zmek ve bunlarÄ± kimin yazdÄ±ÄŸÄ±nÄ± tanÄ±mak. CNN, CRNN, SVM, Siamese Networks ve XGBoost konfigÃ¼rasyonlarÄ± aynÄ± deneysel boru hattÄ±nda Ã§alÄ±ÅŸÄ±r; bÃ¶ylece biyometrik doÄŸrulama, adli analiz ve akÄ±llÄ± dokÃ¼man iÅŸ akÄ±ÅŸlarÄ± iÃ§in yeniden Ã¼retilebilir bir plan Ã§Ä±kar. ## Proje Motivasyonu Klasik el yazÄ±sÄ± sistemleri yalnÄ±zca _ne_ yazÄ±ldÄ±ÄŸÄ±nÄ± Ã¶ÄŸrenir. Bu boru hattÄ± aynÄ± zamanda yazÄ± baskÄ±sÄ±, aralÄ±k, eÄŸim ve ritim gibi ipuÃ§larÄ±nÄ± yakalayarak _kim_ yazdÄ± sorusunu da modeller. TanÄ±ma ve doÄŸrulama modelleri aynÄ± veri yolunu paylaÅŸtÄ±ÄŸÄ±ndan, az Ã¶rnek olsa bile sistem yazarÄ± atayabilir. ## Veri Seti ve Ã–n Ä°ÅŸleme - En Ã§ok Ã¶rneÄŸe sahip 49 IAM yazar seÃ§ildi; 4.207 tek kanallÄ± 113Ã—113 gÃ¶rÃ¼ntÃ¼ elde edildi. - Kenar boÅŸluklarÄ± kÄ±rpma, gri seviye normalizasyonu ve zenginleÅŸtirme (dÃ¶ndÃ¼rme, ters Ã§evirme, gÃ¼rÃ¼ltÃ¼) uygulandÄ±. - Yazar etiketleri one-hot kodlandÄ±; dengeli kalmasÄ± iÃ§in katmanlÄ± train/validation/test bÃ¶lmeleri kullanÄ±ldÄ±.
DoÄŸrulama probleminin zorluÄŸu el yazÄ±sÄ±nÄ±n ayÄ±rt ediciliÄŸine gÃ¶re deÄŸiÅŸiyor. Bu yÃ¼zden insan denetimi iÃ§in iki niteliksel grup oluÅŸturdum:
## Model Mimarileri ### CNN Mekansal stroke Ã¶zelliklerini Ã§Ä±karÄ±r; taban sÄ±nÄ±flandÄ±rÄ±cÄ± olarak ~%77 yazar doÄŸruluÄŸu saÄŸlar. ### CRNN CNN ve BiLSTM katmanlarÄ±nÄ± istifler; ÅŸekil, ritim ve sÄ±rayÄ± Ã¶ÄŸrenir. CTC kaybÄ± hÄ±zlÄ± transkripsiyonun yanÄ±nda ~%88 yazar doÄŸruluÄŸu sunar. ### CNN + SVM CNN gÃ¶mÃ¼lerini SVM ayrÄ±m sÄ±nÄ±rÄ±na besler; ~%87 doÄŸruluk, derin Ã¶zellikleri kÃ¼Ã§Ã¼k veri kÃ¼meleri iÃ§in klasik ML ile harmanlar. ### CRNN + SVM Zamansal CRNN Ã¶zelliklerini SVM sÄ±nÄ±flandÄ±rÄ±cÄ±sÄ±na verir; %89,9 doÄŸruluk ve yazarlar arasÄ± deÄŸiÅŸime karÅŸÄ± daha iyi saÄŸlamlÄ±k Ã¼retir. ### CRNN + XGBoost CRNN Ã¶znitelik vektÃ¶rlerinde gradient-boosted aÄŸaÃ§lar Ã§alÄ±ÅŸtÄ±rÄ±r, karmaÅŸÄ±k etkileÅŸimleri yakalar ve %90,32 ile en iyi doÄŸruluÄŸu elde eder. ### Siamese Network AÄŸÄ±rlÄ±k paylaÅŸan CNN ikizlerini kontrastif kayÄ±pla kullanÄ±r; iki Ã¶rneÄŸin aynÄ± yazardan gelip gelmediÄŸine karar verir. ~%85 doÄŸrulama doÄŸruluÄŸu, ek bir gÃ¼venlik katmanÄ± saÄŸlar. ## Ã‡ok GÃ¶revli Ã–ÄŸrenme PaylaÅŸÄ±lan konvolÃ¼syonel ve tekrarlayan katmanlar her iki gÃ¶revi aynÄ± anda Ã¶ÄŸrenir: 1. CTC tabanlÄ± el yazÄ±sÄ± tanÄ±ma. 2. Stil odaklÄ± yazar sÄ±nÄ±flandÄ±rma. Bu paylaÅŸÄ±mlÄ± Ã¶zellik havuzu daha zengin temsiller, daha verimli eÄŸitim ve gerÃ§ek adli boru hatlarÄ±na benzeyen akÄ±ÅŸlar Ã¼retir. ### Optimizasyon ve EÄŸitim KararlÄ±lÄ±ÄŸÄ± CRNN varyantlarÄ±, yakÄ±nsamaya kadar aÅŸamalÄ± Ã¶ÄŸrenme oranÄ± pencereleriyle Ã§alÄ±ÅŸtÄ±rÄ±ldÄ±. Gradyan kÄ±rpma ve CTC stabilizasyonu sayesinde kayÄ±p eÄŸrileri dÃ¼zgÃ¼n kaldÄ±:
## Performans Ã–zeti | Model | DoÄŸruluk | Notlar | | ---------------------- | -------- | ------------------------------------------------------ | | CNN | 77.70% | GÃ¼Ã§lÃ¼ mekansal Ã¶ÄŸrenici, sÄ±nÄ±rlÄ± zamansal modelleme | | CRNN | 88.69% | ÃœstÃ¼n dizi modelleme | | CNN + SVM | 87.46% | Derin Ã¶zellikler + klasik sÄ±nÄ±r | | CRNN + SVM | 89.96% | Zamansal Ã¶zellikler ve SVM sinerjisi | | **CRNN + XGBoost** | **90.32%** | **En iyi genel performans** | | Siamese (doÄŸrulama) | 85.35% | Ä°kili puanlama, yazar doÄŸrulama | Her deney; karÄ±ÅŸÄ±klÄ±k matrisleri, yazar baÅŸÄ±na metrikler ve olasÄ±lÄ±k daÄŸÄ±lÄ±m grafikleri ile gelir.
## GÃ¼Ã§lÃ¼ Yanlar - Tek bir boru hattÄ±nda Ã§oklu mimariyi kapsamlÄ± ÅŸekilde kÄ±yaslar. - Dengeli IAM alt kÃ¼mesiyle adil deÄŸerlendirme. - CRNN + XGBoost ve CRNN + SVMâ€™den gÃ¼Ã§lÃ¼ hibrit performans. - Siamese doÄŸrulama katmanÄ± biyometrik daÄŸÄ±tÄ±mlara zemin hazÄ±rlar. - Adli paydaÅŸlara yÃ¶nelik gÃ¶rselleÅŸtirmeler ve raporlama. ## Temel KatkÄ±lar - AltÄ± modeli (CNN, CRNN, hibritler, Siamese) tek altyapÄ±da, tekdÃ¼zen loglama ile eÄŸittim ve kÄ±yasladÄ±m. - CRNN Ã¶zelliklerini XGBoostâ€™a besleyen yazar-ID yaklaÅŸÄ±mÄ±nÄ± tanÄ±ttÄ±m. - Transkripsiyon ve yazar kimliÄŸinin aynÄ± aÄŸÄ± paylaÅŸtÄ±ÄŸÄ± Ã§ift gÃ¶revli Ã¶ÄŸrenmeyi gÃ¶sterdim. - Yeniden Ã¼retilebilirlik iÃ§in dengeli IAM alt kÃ¼mesi boru hattÄ±nÄ± yayÄ±mladÄ±m. ## Uygulamalar - Adli dokÃ¼man incelemeleri ve imza/Ã§ek doÄŸrulama. - Biyometrik kimlik doÄŸrulama sistemleri. - ArÅŸiv otomasyonu ve tarihÃ® el yazÄ±sÄ± analitiÄŸi. - BankacÄ±lÄ±k veya sÃ¶zleÅŸme kontrolÃ¼ iÃ§in akÄ±llÄ± el yazÄ±sÄ± analizi. ## SonuÃ§ CRNN + XGBoost kombinasyonu, derin ardÄ±ÅŸÄ±k Ã¶ÄŸrenme ile ensemble kararlarÄ±nÄ±n birbirini nasÄ±l gÃ¼Ã§lendirdiÄŸini kanÄ±tlÄ±yor; Siamese doÄŸrulayÄ±cÄ± ise Ã¼retim sistemlerinin beklediÄŸi kimlik kontrol katmanÄ±nÄ± saÄŸlÄ±yor. Genel olarak boru hattÄ± hem bilimsel titizlik hem saha hazÄ±rlÄ±ÄŸÄ± sunuyor. ## Ã–zet IAM el yazÄ±sÄ±nÄ± CTC ile Ã§Ã¶zerken yazar kimliÄŸini de Ã¶ÄŸrenen uÃ§tan uca bir AI boru hattÄ± kurdum; CRNN + XGBoostâ€™u en yÃ¼ksek doÄŸruluÄŸa taÅŸÄ±dÄ±m ve ek gÃ¼venlik iÃ§in Siamese doÄŸrulama katmanÄ±nÄ± ekledim.

document.title: Lityum-Ä°yon Batarya YaÅŸlanma Analizi
document.description: Stanford Energy Control Lab verileriyle kapasite kaybÄ±, empedans artÄ±ÅŸÄ± ve enerji dÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼nÃ¼ modelleyen, Random Forest ve doÄŸrusal regresyonla SOH tahmini yapan 23 aylÄ±k Ã§alÄ±ÅŸma.

body.raw:
## Genel BakÄ±ÅŸ Bu Ã§alÄ±ÅŸma, Stanford Energy Control Lab'in 23 aylÄ±k verisini kullanarak lityum-iyon batarya kapasite kaybÄ±, empedans artÄ±ÅŸÄ± ve enerji bozulmasÄ±nÄ± inceliyor. Ä°leri istatistik, keÅŸifsel veri analizi, anomali tespiti ve makine Ã¶ÄŸrenmesi birleÅŸtirilerek BMS daÄŸÄ±tÄ±mlarÄ±, EV bakÄ±mÄ± ve ÅŸebeke Ã¶lÃ§ekli depolama iÃ§in eyleme dÃ¶nÃ¼k SaÄŸlÄ±k Durumu (SOH) tahminleri Ã¼retiliyor. ## Motivasyon - Kapasite kaybÄ±, empedans artÄ±ÅŸÄ± ve termal stres; EV'ler ve sabit depolama iÃ§in riski yÃ¼kseltiyor. - DoÄŸru SOH kestirimi, garanti maruziyeti, Kalan FaydalÄ± Ã–mÃ¼r planlamasÄ± ve kimya Ar-Ge'sini bilgilendiriyor. - Boru hattÄ± gerÃ§ek sÃ¼rÃ¼ÅŸ/ÅŸarj desenleriyle eÄŸitildiÄŸinden, saha verisine dayalÄ± yÃ¼ksek doÄŸrulukta Ã¶ngÃ¶rÃ¼ler Ã¼retiyor. ## Veri Seti Modeller iki tamamlayÄ±cÄ± kaynaktan besleniyor: 1. **Ã‡evrim (cycling) verisi:** CC/CV ÅŸarj ve UDDS deÅŸarj profilleri boyunca voltaj, akÄ±m, sÄ±caklÄ±k, kapasite, adÄ±m indeksi ve test zamanÄ±nÄ± yakalar. 2. **TanÄ±sal veri:** Periyodik kapasite testleri, EIS ve HPPC oturumlarÄ±; gÃ¼nlÃ¼k Ã§evrimlerin kaÃ§Ä±rabileceÄŸi uzun vadeli bozulma eÄŸilimlerini aÃ§Ä±ÄŸa Ã§Ä±karÄ±r. ## KeÅŸifsel Veri Analizi - **Voltaj ve AkÄ±m:** Åžarj ~4.20 V seviyesinde dengelenirken akÄ±m kontrol altÄ±nda kalÄ±r. - **Kapasite DÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼:** Erken formasyon kaybÄ± keskin bir dÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼ÅŸ olarak gÃ¶rÃ¼lÃ¼r, ardÄ±ndan kademeli stabilizasyon gelir. - **SÄ±caklÄ±k:** Okumalar ~23 Â°C civarÄ±nda kÃ¼melenir, yÃ¼ksek yÃ¼k olaylarÄ±nda sÄ±Ã§rar. - **Korelasyon:** DeÅŸarj Enerjisi â†” Test ZamanÄ± ve Voltaj â†” AdÄ±m Ä°ndeksi gibi gÃ¼Ã§lÃ¼ iliÅŸkiler Ã¶zellik mÃ¼hendisliÄŸine rehberlik eder. - **Anomali Tespiti:** Isolation Forest, eÄŸitim Ã¶ncesi Ã§Ä±karÄ±lan anormal voltaj dÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼ÅŸlerini, termal sÄ±Ã§ramalarÄ± ve dÃ¼zensiz deÅŸarjlarÄ± iÅŸaretler.
## Makine Ã–ÄŸrenmesi Boru HattÄ± Ä°ki tahmin gÃ¶revi modeli yÃ¶nlendiriyor: 1. **SaÄŸlÄ±k Durumu (SOH) Tahmini** 2. **DeÅŸarj Enerjisi (Wh) Tahmini** Ã–zellikler, fiziksel anlamÄ± net olan sinyallere odaklanarak Ã§evrim ve tanÄ±sal akÄ±ÅŸlardan geliyor. ### SOH Tahmini (Random Forest) - **Girdiler:** Test zamanÄ±, voltaj, akÄ±m ve ÅŸarj enerjisi. - **BaÅŸarÄ±m:** RÂ² = 0.9875, MAE = 0.14, RMSE = 0.24. - On katlÄ± Ã§apraz doÄŸrulama genelleme gÃ¼cÃ¼nÃ¼ onaylÄ±yor; model gerÃ§ek zamanlÄ± BMS entegrasyonuna hazÄ±r.
### Enerji Tahmini (DoÄŸrusal Regresyon) DeÅŸarj enerjisi, test zamanÄ± ve adÄ±m indeksinin doÄŸrusal birleÅŸimiyle modellenir: ``` E_discharge = Î²0 + Î²1 * TestTime + Î²2 * StepIndex ``` - **RÂ²:** 0.7321 - **RMSE:** 3.04 - **MAE:** 2.37 Bu hafif tahminleyici, gÃ¶mÃ¼lÃ¼ sistemler iÃ§in hÄ±zlÄ± enerji Ã¶ngÃ¶rÃ¼leri saÄŸlar. ### KÃ¼meleme Analizi K-Means, Ã§evrimleri Ã¼Ã§ bozulma profiline ayÄ±rÄ±r: - **KÃ¼me 1 â€” SaÄŸlÄ±klÄ±:** En yÃ¼ksek kapasite, en dÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼k sÄ±caklÄ±k varyansÄ±. - **KÃ¼me 2 â€” Orta YaÅŸlanma:** Ã–ngÃ¶rÃ¼lebilir voltaj davranÄ±ÅŸÄ± ve orta seviyede bozulma. - **KÃ¼me 3 â€” Ä°leri YaÅŸlanma:** SÄ±k voltaj dÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼ÅŸleri, termal istikrarsÄ±zlÄ±k ve minimal kapasite. Bu kÃ¼meler, hedefli bakÄ±m ve deÄŸiÅŸim stratejilerini destekler. ## Ã–nemli Bulgular - Random Forest SOH modeli, neredeyse kusursuz doÄŸrulukla yayÄ±mlanmÄ±ÅŸ kÄ±yaslarÄ± aÅŸÄ±yor. - Test zamanÄ±, voltaj, akÄ±m ve adÄ±m indeksi baskÄ±n Ã¶ngÃ¶rdÃ¼rÃ¼cÃ¼ler olarak Ã¶ne Ã§Ä±kÄ±yor. - K-Means, proaktif kararlar iÃ§in belirgin bozulma davranÄ±ÅŸ gruplarÄ±nÄ± ortaya Ã§Ä±karÄ±yor. - Isolation Forest, veri kalitesini ve modele gÃ¼veni artÄ±rÄ±yor. - KÃ¼Ã§Ã¼k sÄ±caklÄ±k deÄŸiÅŸimleri bile SOH dÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼yle gÃ¼Ã§lÃ¼ biÃ§imde iliÅŸkili; termal yÃ¶netim ihtiyacÄ±nÄ± vurguluyor. ## Pratik Uygulamalar - **BMS:** GerÃ§ek zamanlÄ± SOH ve Kalan FaydalÄ± Ã–mÃ¼r tahminleri, otomatik bozulma uyarÄ±larÄ±. - **EV FilolarÄ±:** Ã–ngÃ¶rÃ¼lÃ¼ bakÄ±m, menzil doÄŸruluÄŸu iyileÅŸtirmeleri ve garanti optimizasyonu. - **Ar-Ge ve Ãœretim:** Erken Ã§evrim kayÄ±plarÄ±nÄ±n tanÄ±sÄ±, yeni kimya deÄŸerlendirmesi, iyileÅŸtirilmiÅŸ formasyon sÃ¼reÃ§leri. ## SonuÃ§ Ä°statistiksel analiz, EDA, Random Forest, doÄŸrusal regresyon, kÃ¼meleme ve anomali tespiti birleÅŸimi; lityum-iyon batarya yaÅŸlanmasÄ±na tam bir bakÄ±ÅŸ sunuyor. SOH tahminlerinde RÂ² = 0.9875 ile boru hattÄ±, veri odaklÄ± tanÄ±larÄ±n EV ve endÃ¼striyel enerji depolamayÄ± nasÄ±l dÃ¶nÃ¼ÅŸtÃ¼rebileceÄŸini gÃ¶sterirken gelecekteki Ã¶ngÃ¶rÃ¼cÃ¼ batarya analitiÄŸi iÃ§in saÄŸlam bir temel atÄ±yor. ## Ã–zet 23 aylÄ±k Ã§evrim ve tanÄ±sal veriyi iÃ§eri alÄ±p kapasite kaybÄ± ve enerji bozulmasÄ±nÄ± yÃ¼ksek doÄŸruluklu Random Forest ve regresyon tabanlarÄ±yla modelleyen; riskli Ã§evrimleri K-Means ve Isolation Forest ile yakalayan kapsamlÄ± bir batarya yaÅŸlanma analizi geliÅŸtirdim.

## Genel BakÄ±ÅŸ Visa Application Management System (VAMS), konsolosluklar, vize merkezleri ve gÃ¶Ã§menlik kurumlarÄ±nÄ±n gerÃ§ek hayattaki iÅŸ birliÄŸini yansÄ±tan tam bir veritabanÄ± tasarÄ±mÄ±dÄ±r. BaÅŸvuru sahipleri, baÅŸvuru merkezleri, konsolosluklar ve finans ekipleri gibi tÃ¼m aktÃ¶rler normalize tablolar, zorunlu yabancÄ± anahtarlar ve iÅŸ akÄ±ÅŸÄ± kurallarÄ±yla modellenir; bÃ¶ylece vize yaÅŸam dÃ¶ngÃ¼sÃ¼ belirsizlik olmadan sorgulanabilir, denetlenebilir ve raporlanabilir. ## Sistem Hedefleri - TÃ¼m baÅŸvuru sahibi, pasaport, dokÃ¼man ve Ã¶deme verisini tek bir iliÅŸkisel doÄŸruluk kaynaÄŸÄ±nda toplamak. - GÃ¶nderim, inceleme, karar ve basÄ±m olaylarÄ±nÄ± referans bÃ¼tÃ¼nlÃ¼ÄŸÃ¼yle izlemek. - BaÅŸvurularÄ±n merkezler ve konsolosluklar arasÄ±nda nasÄ±l aktÄ±ÄŸÄ±nÄ± modelleyerek tekrar veya anomaliyi Ã¶nlemek. - Analitik, mevzuat kontrolleri ve operasyonel paneller iÃ§in doÄŸru birleÅŸimler saÄŸlamak. ## Ana VarlÄ±klar ve Sorumluluklar ### Applicant (BaÅŸvuru Sahibi) Kimlik, demografik ve iletiÅŸim bilgilerini tutar. Birden Ã§ok pasaporta sahip olabilir, birden Ã§ok baÅŸvuru aÃ§abilir ve Ã¼cret Ã¶demesi yapabilir. Uyruk, doÄŸum ve iletiÅŸim alanlarÄ± konsolosluk gereksinimleri iÃ§in zorunludur. ### Passport (Pasaport) Pasaport numarasÄ± (PK), veriliÅŸ/bitiÅŸ tarihleri, veren makam ve tÃ¼rÃ¼ saklar. Her kayÄ±t tek bir baÅŸvuru sahibine baÄŸlÄ±dÄ±r, ancak bir baÅŸvuru sahibi zaman iÃ§inde sÄ±fÄ±r ya da Ã§ok pasaporta sahip olabilir. ### Application (BaÅŸvuru) Her vize talebini; kimlikler, seyahat amacÄ±, hedef Ã¼lke, gÃ¶nderim zamanÄ± ve durum geÃ§iÅŸleri (Beklemede, Ä°ncelemede, OnaylandÄ±, Reddedildi) ile temsil eder. Her baÅŸvuru gerekli belgelere, bir gÃ¶nderim merkezine ve inceleyen konsolosluÄŸa baÄŸlÄ±dÄ±r. ### Application Documents (BaÅŸvuru Belgeleri) Vize sÄ±nÄ±fÄ± baÅŸÄ±na gereken belgeleri (isim, aÃ§Ä±klama, geÃ§erlilik aralÄ±ÄŸÄ±) tanÄ±mlar. Belgeler, birleÅŸme tablolarÄ± Ã¼zerinden yeniden kullanÄ±labilir. ### Payment (Ã–deme) Ã–deme kimliÄŸi, tutar, yÃ¶ntem, para birimi ve Ã¼cret adÄ± ile iÅŸlemleri kaydeder. Her Ã¶deme, Ã¶demeyi yapan baÅŸvuru sahibine ve parayÄ± alan baÅŸvuru merkezine (`Made_To`) referans verir. ### Application Center (BaÅŸvuru Merkezi) Ä°letiÅŸim, adres, Ã§alÄ±ÅŸma saatleri ve randevu kapasitesiyle vize baÅŸvuru ofislerini modeller. Hem evrak hem Ã¶deme akÄ±ÅŸÄ±nda baÅŸvuru sahibi ile konsolosluk arasÄ±nda aracÄ± rolÃ¼dÃ¼r. ### Consulate (Konsolosluk) DavalarÄ± inceleyen ve nihai kararÄ± veren otoriteyi (PK = Konsolosluk AdÄ±) temsil eder. Yetki alanÄ±, iletiÅŸim kanallarÄ± ve lokasyonlarÄ± saklar; birÃ§ok baÅŸvuru tÃ¼rÃ¼nÃ¼ veya Ã¼lkeyi yÃ¶netebilir. ### Visa Result (Vize Sonucu) Ä°ÅŸlenen her baÅŸvuru iÃ§in resmi sonucu, onay/red, gerekÃ§e ve sonuÃ§ kimliÄŸiyle yakalar. Hem inceleyen konsolosluÄŸa hem de karar olumluysa vize kaydÄ±na baÄŸlanÄ±r. ### Visa (Vize) BasÄ±lmÄ±ÅŸ vizeleri; kimlik, vize tÃ¼rÃ¼ (turistik/iÅŸ/Ã¶ÄŸrenci vb.), geÃ§erlilik aralÄ±ÄŸÄ± ve veren konsoloslukla somutlaÅŸtÄ±rÄ±r. Vize ancak onaylanmÄ±ÅŸ bir vize sonucu varsa oluÅŸur; baÄŸÄ±mlÄ±lÄ±k kÄ±sÄ±tÄ±nÄ± pekiÅŸtirir. ## Ä°liÅŸki Modelleme - **Applicant â†” Passport:** Bire-Ã§ok sahiplik; her pasaport tek bir baÅŸvuru sahibine aittir. - **Applicant â†” Application:** BaÅŸvuru sahipleri birden Ã§ok talep aÃ§abilir. - **Application â†” Documents:** Ã‡oktan Ã§oÄŸa; gereksinim tablolarÄ± Ã¼zerinden belge yeniden kullanÄ±mÄ±na izin verir. - **Application Center:** BaÅŸvurularÄ± ve Ã¶demeleri alÄ±r; giriÅŸ ve tahsilat noktasÄ±dÄ±r. - **Consulate â†” Application:** Her baÅŸvuru bir konsoloslukÃ§a incelenir. - **Consulate â†” Visa Result:** Kararlar konsolosluklardan doÄŸar ve aÅŸaÄŸÄ± akÄ±ÅŸtaki vize kayÄ±tlarÄ±na referans olur. - **Visa Result â†” Visa:** Vizeler yalnÄ±zca onaylÄ± karar sonrasÄ± yaratÄ±lÄ±r; yaÅŸam dÃ¶ngÃ¼sÃ¼ sÄ±rasÄ±nÄ± korur. GeliÅŸtirilmiÅŸ ER diyagramÄ± kardinalite ve katÄ±lÄ±m kÄ±sÄ±tlarÄ±nÄ± yakalayarak verinin taraflar arasÄ±nda nasÄ±l hareket ettiÄŸini netleÅŸtirir.
## Ä°liÅŸkisel Åžema ve Normalizasyon TÃ¼m tablolar ÃœÃ§Ã¼ncÃ¼ Normal Form dÃ¼zeyinde normalize edilmiÅŸtir; kÄ±smi ve geÃ§iÅŸli baÄŸÄ±mlÄ±lÄ±klar elimine edilmiÅŸtir. Birincil anahtarlar aÃ§Ä±kÃ§a tanÄ±mlÄ±dÄ±r, yabancÄ± anahtarlar referans bÃ¼tÃ¼nlÃ¼ÄŸÃ¼ saÄŸlar ve her Ã¶znitelik atomiktir. Bu, tutarlÄ± gÃ¼ncellemeler, verimli join'ler ve yoÄŸun operasyonel yÃ¼k altÄ±nda bile anomaliden arÄ±nmÄ±ÅŸ raporlama garantiler. ## Sistem GÃ¼Ã§leri - Vize iÅŸ akÄ±ÅŸlarÄ± iÃ§in Ã¶zel tasarlanmÄ±ÅŸ, yÃ¼ksek normalize iliÅŸkisel Ã§ekirdek. - BaÅŸvuru giriÅŸinden karar ve basÄ±ma kadar izlenebilir iÅŸleme boru hattÄ±. - BaÅŸvuru sahipleri, merkezler, konsolosluklar ve finans kayÄ±tlarÄ± arasÄ±nda net sorumluluk ayrÄ±mÄ±. - GerÃ§ek dÃ¼nyadaki hesap verebilirliÄŸi yansÄ±tan gÃ¼Ã§lÃ¼ yabancÄ± anahtar kÄ±sÄ±tlarÄ±. - Analist veya geliÅŸtiricilerin hÄ±zlÄ± adapte olmasÄ± iÃ§in kapsamlÄ± EER dokÃ¼mantasyonu. ## OlasÄ± GeliÅŸtirmeler - Kim neyi ne zaman deÄŸiÅŸtirdi kaydÄ±nÄ± tutmak iÃ§in audit log eklemek. - Her mikro aÅŸamayÄ± (gÃ¶nderim â†’ inceleme â†’ karar â†’ basÄ±m) kapsayacak durum takibi geniÅŸletmek. - Aile veya Ã§ok amaÃ§lÄ± seyahat iÃ§in tek baÅŸvuruda birden fazla vize tipine izin vermek. - Ã‡evrim iÃ§i randevu ve gÃ¼venli baÅŸvuru sahibi kimlik doÄŸrulamasÄ±nÄ± entegre etmek. - UÃ§tan uca izlenebilirlik iÃ§in metadata yanÄ±nda ikili dokÃ¼man yÃ¼klerini (BLOB/CLOB) saklamak. ## SonuÃ§ VAMS, uluslararasÄ± vize iÅŸlemlerinin nÃ¼ansÄ±nÄ± yakalayan kurumsal dÃ¼zeyde veri modellemesini gÃ¶steriyor. Proje, geliÅŸmiÅŸ ER dÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼ncesini, disiplinli normalizasyonu ve iÅŸ akÄ±ÅŸÄ± odaklÄ± ÅŸemayÄ±; hÃ¼kÃ¼metlerin, konsolosluklarÄ±n veya bÃ¼yÃ¼k vize merkezlerinin minimum deÄŸiÅŸiklikle benimseyebileceÄŸi bir biÃ§imde ortaya koyuyor. ## Ã–zet VAMS, baÅŸvurudan vize basÄ±mÄ±na kadar tÃ¼m aÅŸamalarÄ±, normalizasyon ve sÄ±kÄ± referans bÃ¼tÃ¼nlÃ¼ÄŸÃ¼yle tutarlÄ± kÄ±lan kurumsal Ã¶lÃ§ekli bir veritabanÄ± tasarÄ±mÄ±; bÃ¶ylece baÅŸvuru sahibi, merkez, konsolosluk, Ã¶deme ve kararlarÄ± gÃ¼venle izleyebiliyorum.
